fields.description: Numeric computed value to represent lifetime tobacco exposure defined as number of cigarettes smoked per day x number of years smoked divided by 20.
fields.name: pack_years_smoked

fields.description: A combination of date and time of day in the form [-]CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[Z|(+|-)hh:mm]
fields.name: created_datetime

fields.description: The year in which the participant began smoking.
fields.name: tobacco_smoking_onset_year

fields.description: The yes/no/unknown indicator used to describe whether the patient was exposed to asbestos.
fields.name: asbestos_exposure

fields.description: The current state of the object.
fields.name: state

fields.description: The text term used to describe the approximate amount of time elapsed between the time the patient wakes up in the morning to the time they smoke their first cigarette.
fields.name: time_between_waking_and_first_smoke

fields.description: A project-specific identifier for a node. This property is the calling card/nickname/alias for a unit of submission. It can be used in place of the UUID for identifying or recalling a node.
fields.name: submitter_id

fields.description: The height of the patient in centimeters.
fields.name: height

fields.description: Numeric value used to represent the age of the patient when exposure to a specific environmental factor began.
fields.name: age_at_onset

fields.description: Numeric value (or unknown) to represent the number of years a person has been smoking.
fields.name: years_smoked

fields.description: The yes/no/unknown indicator used to describe whether a patient was exposed to smoke that is emitted from burning tobacco, including cigarettes, pipes, and cigars. This includes tobacco smoke exhaled by smokers.
fields.name: environmental_tobacco_smoke_exposure

fields.description: Numeric value that represents the number of times the patient uses tobacco each day.
fields.name: tobacco_use_per_day

fields.description: Numeric value used to describe the average number of alcoholic beverages  a person consumes per day.
fields.name: alcohol_drinks_per_day

fields.description: The text term used to generally decribe how often the patient smokes.
fields.name: smoking_frequency

fields.description: A combination of date and time of day in the form [-]CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[Z|(+|-)hh:mm]
fields.name: updated_datetime

fields.description: The text term used to indicate whether the patient was exposed to secondhand smoke as a child.
fields.name: secondhand_smoke_as_child

fields.description: The average number of cigarettes smoked per day.
fields.name: cigarettes_per_day

fields.description: The text term used to describe the patient's specific type of smoke exposure.
fields.name: type_of_smoke_exposure

fields.description: The weight of the patient measured in kilograms.
fields.name: weight

fields.description: Category describing current smoking status and smoking history as self-reported by a patient.
fields.name: tobacco_smoking_status

fields.description: The text term used to describe the specific type of tobacco used by the patient.
fields.name: type_of_tobacco_used

fields.description: The year in which the participant quit smoking.
fields.name: tobacco_smoking_quit_year

fields.description: The yes/no/unknown indicator used to describe whether the patient was exposed to radon.
fields.name: radon_exposure

fields.description: The yes/no/unknown indicator used to describe whether a patient was exposured to respirable crystalline silica, a widespread, naturally occurring, crystalline metal oxide that consists of different forms including quartz, cristobalite, tridymite, tripoli, ganister, chert and novaculite.
fields.name: respirable_crystalline_silica_exposure

fields.description: Numeric value that represents the number of times the patient uses marijuana each day.
fields.name: marijuana_use_per_week

fields.description: Text term used to describe the length of time the patient was exposed to an environmental factor.
fields.name: exposure_duration

fields.description: The text term used to describe the type of environmental exposure.
fields.name: exposure_type

fields.description: A response to a question that asks whether the participant has consumed at least 12 drinks of any kind of alcoholic beverage in their lifetime.
fields.name: alcohol_history

fields.description: A calculated numerical quantity that represents an individual's weight to height ratio.
fields.name: bmi

fields.description: The yes/no/unknown indicator used to describe whether a patient was exposed to fine powder derived by the crushing of coal.
fields.name: coal_dust_exposure

fields.description: Category to describe the patient's current level of alcohol use as self-reported by the patient.
fields.name: alcohol_intensity

fields.description: Numeric value used to describe the average number of days each week that a person consumes an alcoholic beverage.
fields.name: alcohol_days_per_week

fields.description: Text term that represents the type of vascular tumor invasion.
fields.name: vascular_invasion_type

fields.description: The text term used to describe the classification of rhabdomyosarcoma tumors, as defined by the Intergroup Rhabdomyosarcoma Study (IRS).
fields.name: irs_stage

fields.description: The yes/no/unknown indicator used to describe the presence of tumor deposits in the pericolic or perirectal fat or in adjacent mesentery away from the leading edge of the tumor.
fields.name: non_nodal_tumor_deposits

fields.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date of the patient was thought to have the best overall response to their disease.
fields.name: days_to_best_overall_response

fields.description: A combination of date and time of day in the form [-]CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[Z|(+|-)hh:mm]
fields.name: created_datetime

fields.description: The text term used to describe the secondary Gleason score, which describes the pattern of cells making up the second largest area of the tumor. The primary and secondary Gleason pattern grades are combined to determine the patient's Gleason grade group, which is used to determine the aggresiveness of prostate cancer. Note that this grade describes the entire prostatectomy specimen and is not specific to the sample used for sequencing.
fields.name: secondary_gleason_grade

fields.description: The text term used to describe the version or edition of the American Joint Committee on Cancer Staging Handbooks, a publication by the group formed for the purpose of developing a system of staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.
fields.name: ajcc_staging_system_edition

fields.description: The text term used to describe the clinical classification of lymphoma, as defined by the Ann Arbor Lymphoma Staging System.
fields.name: ann_arbor_clinical_stage

fields.description: Age at the time of diagnosis expressed in number of days since birth.
fields.name: age_at_diagnosis

fields.description: Text term that describes the last known state or condition of an individual's neoplasm.
fields.name: last_known_disease_status

fields.description: Text term used to describe the classification of rhabdomyosarcoma tumors, as defined by the Intergroup Rhabdomyosarcoma Study (IRS).
fields.name: irs_group

fields.description: The yes/no/unknown indicator used to describe whether micropapillary features were determined to be present.
fields.name: micropapillary_features

fields.description: Text term used to describe the patient's first symptom experienced prior to diagnosis and thought to be related to the disease.
fields.name: first_symptom_prior_to_diagnosis

fields.description: The yes/no/unknown/not reported indicator used to describe whether the tumor is located across the gastroesophageal junction.
fields.name: gastric_esophageal_junction_involvement

fields.description: The current state of the object.
fields.name: state

fields.description: Text term used to describe the classification of rhabdomyosarcoma, as defined by the Children's Oncology Group (COG).
fields.name: cog_rhabdomyosarcoma_risk_group

fields.description: The text term used to describe an extension of the tumor beyond the opening into the ventricles and vocal cords.
fields.name: transglottic_extension

fields.description: The multiple myeloma disease stage at diagnosis.
fields.name: iss_stage

fields.description: The extent of a cancer, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body based on AJCC staging criteria.
fields.name: ajcc_pathologic_stage

fields.description: The text term used to describe the overall grouping of grades defined by the Gleason grading classification, which is used to determine the aggressiveness of prostate cancer. Note that this grade describes the entire prostatectomy specimen and is not specific to the sample used for sequencing.
fields.name: gleason_grade_group

fields.description: Text term and code that represents the metastatic stage of the musculoskeletal sarcoma, using the Enneking staging system approved by the Musculoskeletal Tumor Society (MSTS).
fields.name: enneking_msts_metastasis

fields.description: Yes/no/unknown/not reported indicator used to describe whether anaplasia was present at the time of diagnosis.
fields.name: anaplasia_present

fields.description: The text term used to describe the type of papillary renal cell carcinoma characterized by the presence of papillae covered by small cells with scant amount of cytoplasm.
fields.name: papillary_renal_cell_type

fields.description: The third edition of the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, published in 2000 used principally in tumor and cancer registries for coding the site (topography) and the histology (morphology) of neoplasms. The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs. In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains. A system of numbered categories for representation of data.
fields.name: morphology

fields.description: The text term used to describe the anatomic site of origin, of the patient's malignant disease, as described by the World Health Organization's (WHO) International Classification of Diseases for Oncology (ICD-O).
fields.name: site_of_resection_or_biopsy

fields.description: Time interval from the date of last follow up to the date of initial pathologic diagnosis, represented as a calculated number of days.
fields.name: days_to_last_known_disease_status

fields.description: The text term that describes whether the surface tissue (outer boundary) of the ovary shows evidence of involvement or presence of cancer.
fields.name: ovarian_surface_involvement

fields.description: Extent of the primary cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined prior to treatment.
fields.name: ajcc_clinical_t

fields.description: Stage group determined from clinical information on the tumor (T), regional node (N) and metastases (M) and by grouping cases with similar prognosis for cancer.
fields.name: ajcc_clinical_stage

fields.description: The text term used to describe the diameter of the largest focus originating outside of the pelvic peritoneal region.
fields.name: largest_extrapelvic_peritoneal_focus

fields.description: The text term used to describe the primary Gleason score, which describes the pattern of cells making up the largest area of the tumor. The primary and secondary Gleason pattern grades are combined to determine the patient's Gleason grade group, which is used to determine the aggresiveness of prostate cancer. Note that this grade describes the entire prostatectomy specimen and is not specific to the sample used for sequencing.
fields.name: primary_gleason_grade

fields.description: Burkitt's lymphoma categorization based on clinical features that differ from other forms of the same disease.
fields.name: burkitt_lymphoma_clinical_variant

fields.description: The yes/no/unknown indicator used to describe whether the tumor is confined to the organ where it originated and did not spread to a proximal or distant location within the body.
fields.name: tumor_confined_to_organ_of_origin

fields.description: Numeric value that represents the distance between the tumor and the surgical margin
fields.name: margin_distance

fields.description: Extent of the distant metastasis for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined prior to treatment.
fields.name: ajcc_clinical_m

fields.description: Code to represent the defined absence or presence of distant spread or metastases (M) to locations via vascular channels or lymphatics beyond the regional lymph nodes, using criteria established by the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC).
fields.name: ajcc_pathologic_m

fields.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date the patient was diagnosed with the malignant disease.
fields.name: days_to_diagnosis

fields.description: Text term that represents the categorization of patients on the basis of prognostic factors per a system developed by Children's Oncology Group (COG). Risk level is used to assign treatment intensity.
fields.name: cog_neuroblastoma_risk_group

fields.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date the patient's disease recurred.
fields.name: days_to_recurrence

fields.description: The text term used to describe the pathologic classification of lymphoma, as defined by the Ann Arbor Lymphoma Staging System.
fields.name: ann_arbor_pathologic_stage

fields.description: For tumors in paired organs, designates the side on which the cancer originates.
fields.name: laterality

fields.description: The text term used to describe whether the patient had non-nodal regional disease.
fields.name: non_nodal_regional_disease

fields.description: Numeric value to represent the year of an individual's initial pathologic diagnosis of cancer.
fields.name: year_of_diagnosis

fields.description: The best improvement achieved throughout the entire course of protocol treatment.
fields.name: best_overall_response

fields.description: Text term to identify an anatomic site in which metastatic disease involvement is found.
fields.name: metastasis_at_diagnosis_site

fields.description: The text term used to describe the classification of the histopathologic degree of liver damage.
fields.name: ishak_fibrosis_score

fields.description: Text term to specify the location of the supratentorial tumor.
fields.name: supratentorial_localization

fields.description: The text term used to describe the extent of metastatic disease present at diagnosis.
fields.name: metastasis_at_diagnosis

fields.description: The text term used to describe the tertiary pattern as described by the Gleason Grading System.
fields.name: gleason_grade_tertiary

fields.description: The text term used to describe the anatomic site of lymph node involvement.
fields.name: lymph_node_involved_site

fields.description: The text term used to describe the staging classification of liver tumors, as defined by the Children's Oncology Group (COG). This staging system specifically describes the extent of the primary tumor prior to treatment.
fields.name: cog_liver_stage

fields.description: The text term used to describe the surgical grade of the musculoskeletal sarcoma, using the Enneking staging system approved by the Musculoskeletal Tumor Society (MSTS).
fields.name: enneking_msts_grade

fields.description: A project-specific identifier for a node. This property is the calling card/nickname/alias for a unit of submission. It can be used in place of the UUID for identifying or recalling a node.
fields.name: submitter_id

fields.description: The extent of a cancer in the body. Staging is usually based on the size of the tumor, whether lymph nodes contain cancer, and whether the cancer has spread from the original site to other parts of the body. The accepted values for tumor_stage depend on the tumor site, type, and accepted staging system. These items should accompany the tumor_stage value as associated metadata.
fields.name: tumor_stage

fields.description: Numeric value that represents the depth of  tumor invasion, measured in millimeters (mm).
fields.name: tumor_depth

fields.description: The text term used to indicate whether the patient was pregnant at the time they were diagnosed.
fields.name: pregnant_at_diagnosis

fields.description: Text term used to describe the classification of neuroblastic differentiation within neuroblastoma tumors, as defined by the International Neuroblastoma Pathology Classification (INPC).
fields.name: inpc_grade

fields.description: A numeric value used to measure therapeutic response of the primary tumor and predict patient outcomes based on a three-point tumor regression grading system.
fields.name: tumor_regression_grade

fields.description: The text term used to describe the Masaoka staging system, a classification that defines prognostic indicators for thymic malignancies and predicts tumor recurrence.
fields.name: masaoka_stage

fields.description: The text term used to describe the morphologic findings indicating the presence of a malignant cellular infiltrate characterized by the presence of large pleomorphic cells, necrosis, and high mitotic activity in a tissue sample.
fields.name: anaplasia_present_type

fields.description: A yes/no/unknown/not applicable indicator related to the administration of therapeutic agents received before the body specimen was collected.
fields.name: prior_treatment

fields.description: Text terms to describe the status of a tissue margin following surgical resection.
fields.name: residual_disease

fields.description: The number of lymph nodes involved with disease as determined by pathologic examination.
fields.name: lymph_nodes_positive

fields.description: Text term used to describe the patient's histologic diagnosis, as described by the World Health Organization's (WHO) International Classification of Diseases for Oncology (ICD-O).
fields.name: primary_diagnosis

fields.description: The codes that represent the stage of cancer based on the nodes present (N stage) according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.
fields.name: ajcc_pathologic_n

fields.description: Numeric value used to describe the non-peritonealised bare area of rectum, comprising anterior and posterior segments, when submitted as a surgical specimen resulting from excision of cancer of the rectum.
fields.name: circumferential_resection_margin

fields.description: Numeric value used to describe the maximum diameter or dimension of the primary tumor, measured in centimeters.
fields.name: tumor_largest_dimension_diameter

fields.description: The text term used to describe the International Germ Cell Cancer Collaborative Group (IGCCCG), a grouping used to further classify metastatic testicular tumors.
fields.name: igcccg_stage

fields.description: Numeric value that represents the percentage of Patterns 4 and 5, which is used when the Gleason score is greater than 7 to predict prognosis.
fields.name: gleason_patterns_percent

fields.description: Text term used to describe the stage of the musculoskeletal sarcoma, using the Enneking staging system approved by the Musculoskeletal Tumor Society (MSTS).
fields.name: enneking_msts_stage

fields.description: The text term used to describe the staging classification of neuroblastic tumors, as defined by the International Neuroblastoma Risk Group (INRG).
fields.name: inrg_stage

fields.description: Numeric value used to describe the gross pathologic tumor weight, measured in grams.
fields.name: gross_tumor_weight

fields.description: The total number of peripancreatic lymph nodes tested for the presence of pancreatic cancer cells.
fields.name: peripancreatic_lymph_nodes_tested

fields.description: Extent of the regional lymph node involvement for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined prior to treatment.
fields.name: ajcc_clinical_n

fields.description: a yes/no indicator to ask if perineural invasion or infiltration of tumor or cancer is present.
fields.name: perineural_invasion_present

fields.description: Text that describes the kind of disease present in the tumor specimen as related to a specific timepoint.
fields.name: classification_of_tumor

fields.description: The number that describes the distance, in millimeters, between the upper layer of the epidermis and the deepest point of tumor penetration.
fields.name: breslow_thickness

fields.description: Enumerated numeric value or range of values used to describe the number of peripancreatic lymph nodes determined to be positive.
fields.name: peripancreatic_lymph_nodes_positive

fields.description: Code of pathological T (primary tumor) to define the size or contiguous extension of the primary tumor (T), using staging criteria from the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC).
fields.name: ajcc_pathologic_t

fields.description: The text term used to describe whether the patient's disease originated in a single location or multiple locations.
fields.name: tumor_focality

fields.description: The text term used to describe the malignant status of the peritoneal fluid determined by cytologic testing.
fields.name: peritoneal_fluid_cytological_status

fields.description: The number of lymph nodes tested to determine whether lymph nodes were  involved with disease as determined by a pathologic examination.
fields.name: lymph_nodes_tested

fields.description: The percentage of tumor cells spread locally in a malignant neoplasm through infiltration or destruction of adjacent tissue.
fields.name: percent_tumor_invasion

fields.description: Text term used to describe the staging classification of neuroblastic tumors, as defined by the International Neuroblastoma Staging System (INSS).
fields.name: inss_stage

fields.description: A yes/no indicator to ask if small or thin-walled vessel invasion is present, indicating lymphatic involvement
fields.name: lymphatic_invasion_present

fields.description: The text term used to describe the anatomic sites that were involved in the survival margins.
fields.name: margins_involved_site

fields.description: The number of mitoses identified under the microscope in tumors. The method of counting varies, according to the specific tumor examined. Usually, the mitotic count is determined based on the number of mitoses per high power field (40X) or 10 high power fields.
fields.name: mitotic_count

fields.description: Yes/No/Unknown indicator to identify whether a patient has had a new tumor event after initial treatment.
fields.name: progression_or_recurrence

fields.description: The text term used to describe the overall Weiss assessment score, a commonly used assessment describing the malignancy of adrenocortical tumors. The Weiss score is determined based on nine histological criteria including the following: high nuclear grade, mitotic rate greater than five per 50 high power fields (HPF), atypical mitotic figures, eosinophilic tumor cell cytoplasm (greater than 75% tumor cells), diffuse architecture (greater than 33% of tumor), necrosis, venous invasion, sinusoidal invasion, and capsular invasion.
fields.name: weiss_assessment_score

fields.description: The text term used to describe the International Prognostic Index, which classifies the prognosis of patients with aggressive non-Hodgkin's lymphoma.
fields.name: international_prognostic_index

fields.description: The text term used to describe the classification of neuroblastomas distinguishing between favorable and unfavorable histologic groups. The histologic score, defined by the International Neuroblastoma Pathology Classification (INPC), is based on age, mitosis-karyorrhexis index (MKI), stromal content and degree of tumor cell differentiation.
fields.name: inpc_histologic_group

fields.description: Text term to signify whether lymphoma B-symptoms are present as noted in the patient's medical record.
fields.name: ann_arbor_b_symptoms

fields.description: Text term and code that represents the tumor site of the musculoskeletal sarcoma, using the Enneking staging system approved by the Musculoskeletal Tumor Society (MSTS).
fields.name: enneking_msts_tumor_site

fields.description: The extent of a cervical or endometrial cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body, as described by the International Federation of Gynecology and Obstetrics (FIGO) stages.
fields.name: figo_stage

fields.description: Text term that represents the component of the International Neuroblastoma Pathology Classification (INPC) for mitosis-karyorrhexis index (MKI).
fields.name: mitosis_karyorrhexis_index

fields.description: A combination of date and time of day in the form [-]CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[Z|(+|-)hh:mm]
fields.name: updated_datetime

fields.description: Text term used to describe the method used to confirm the patients malignant diagnosis.
fields.name: method_of_diagnosis

fields.description: The text term used to describe the classification of medulloblastoma tumors based on molecular features.
fields.name: medulloblastoma_molecular_classification

fields.description: Numeric value to express the degree of abnormality of cancer cells, a measure of differentiation and aggressiveness.
fields.name: tumor_grade

fields.description: Text term to describe the amount of dysplasia found within the benign esophageal columnar mucosa.
fields.name: esophageal_columnar_dysplasia_degree

fields.description: The text term used to describe the classification used in the prognosis of chronic liver disease, mainly cirrhosis.
fields.name: child_pugh_classification

fields.description: The yes/no/unknown indicator used to describe the patient's history of prior cancer diagnosis.
fields.name: prior_malignancy

fields.description: Indicator that identifies whether a patient with malignant lymphoma has lymphomatous involvement of an extranodal site.
fields.name: ann_arbor_extranodal_involvement

fields.description: The yes/no/unknown indicator used to describe whether esophageal columnar metaplasia was determined to be present.
fields.name: esophageal_columnar_metaplasia_present

fields.description: The text term used to describe the anatomic site of origin, of the patient's malignant disease, as described by the World Health Organization's (WHO) International Classification of Diseases for Oncology (ICD-O).
fields.name: tissue_or_organ_of_origin

fields.description: Numeric value that represents the measurement of the widest portion of the tumor in centimeters.
fields.name: greatest_tumor_dimension

fields.description: Alphanumeric value used to describe the  disease code from the tenth version of the International Classification of Disease (ICD-10).
fields.name: icd_10_code

fields.description: The yes/no/unknown indicator used to describe whether goblet cells were determined to be present in the esophageal columnar mucosa.
fields.name: goblet_cells_columnar_mucosa_present

fields.description: The text term used to describe the classification of Wilms tumors distinguishing between favorable and unfavorable histologic groups.
fields.name: wilms_tumor_histologic_subtype

fields.description: The text term used to describe the physical condition of the involved ovary.
fields.name: ovarian_specimen_status

fields.description: The text term used to describe the staging classification of renal tumors, as defined by the Children's Oncology Group (COG).
fields.name: cog_renal_stage

fields.description: A yes/no/unknown indicator used to describe whether the patient had an additional malignant diagnosis at the same time the tumor used for sequencing was diagnosed. If both tumors were sequenced, both tumors would have synchronous malignancies.
fields.name: synchronous_malignancy

fields.description: Time interval from the date of last follow up to the date of initial pathologic diagnosis, represented as a calculated number of days.
fields.name: days_to_last_follow_up

fields.description: The text term used to describe the edition year of the FIGO staging system used to stage the patient's gynecologic tumor.
fields.name: figo_staging_edition_year

fields.description: The yes/no indicator to ask if large vessel or venous invasion was detected by surgery or presence in a tumor specimen.
fields.name: vascular_invasion_present

fields.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date the treatment started.
fields.name: days_to_treatment_start

fields.description: The text term used to describe the status of the patient's malignancy when the treatment began.
fields.name: initial_disease_status

fields.description: Text term that describes the patient's final outcome after the treatment was administered.
fields.name: treatment_outcome

fields.description: Text identification of the individual agent(s) used as part of a treatment regimen.
fields.name: therapeutic_agents

fields.description: The text term used to describe the reason a specific treatment or regimen ended.
fields.name: reason_treatment_ended

fields.description: The numeric value used to describe the number of cycles of a specific treatment or regimen the patient received.
fields.name: number_of_cycles

fields.description: A project-specific identifier for a node. This property is the calling card/nickname/alias for a unit of submission. It can be used in place of the UUID for identifying or recalling a node.
fields.name: submitter_id

fields.description: A combination of date and time of day in the form [-]CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[Z|(+|-)hh:mm]
fields.name: created_datetime

fields.description: The text term used to describe the regimen or line of therapy.
fields.name: regimen_or_line_of_therapy

fields.description: Text term used to describe the treatment arm assigned to a patient at the time eligibility is determined.
fields.name: treatment_arm

fields.description: The anatomic site or field targeted by a treatment regimen or single agent therapy.
fields.name: treatment_anatomic_site

fields.description: Text term to identify the reason for the administration of a treatment regimen. [Manually-curated]
fields.name: treatment_intent_type

fields.description: Text term that describes the kind of treatment administered.
fields.name: treatment_type

fields.description: The text term used to describe the pathologic effect a treatment(s) had on the tumor.
fields.name: treatment_effect

fields.description: A yes/no/unknown/not applicable indicator related to the administration of therapeutic agents received.
fields.name: treatment_or_therapy

fields.description: A combination of date and time of day in the form [-]CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[Z|(+|-)hh:mm]
fields.name: updated_datetime

fields.description: The text term used to describe the dose units of an agent the patient received.
fields.name: treatment_dose_units

fields.description: The text term used to indicate whether the treatment had an effect on the patient.
fields.name: treatment_effect_indicator

fields.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date the treatment ended.
fields.name: days_to_treatment_end

fields.description: The numeric value used to describe the dose of an agent the patient received.
fields.name: treatment_dose

fields.description: The text term used to describe whether the patient was receiving chemotherapy concurrent to radiation.
fields.name: chemo_concurrent_to_radiation

fields.description: The current state of the object.
fields.name: state

fields.description: The text term used to describe the frequency the patient received an agent or regimen.
fields.name: treatment_frequency

fields.description: A combination of date and time of day in the form [-]CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[Z|(+|-)hh:mm]
fields.name: legacy_updated_datetime

fields.description: Status of the annotation.
fields.name: status

fields.description: Top level characterization of the annotation.
fields.name: category

fields.description: A project-specific identifier for a node. This property is the calling card/nickname/alias for a unit of submission. It can be used in place of the UUID for identifying or recalling a node.
fields.name: submitter_id

fields.description: A combination of date and time of day in the form [-]CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[Z|(+|-)hh:mm]
fields.name: created_datetime

fields.description: A combination of date and time of day in the form [-]CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[Z|(+|-)hh:mm]
fields.name: updated_datetime

fields.description: Top level classification of the annotation.
fields.name: classification

fields.description: A combination of date and time of day in the form [-]CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[Z|(+|-)hh:mm]
fields.name: legacy_created_datetime

fields.description: The current state of the object.
fields.name: state

fields.description: Open entry for any further description or characterization of the data.
fields.name: notes

fields.description: Text designations that identify gender. Gender is described as the assemblage of properties that distinguish people on the basis of their societal roles. [Explanatory Comment 1: Identification of gender is based upon self-report and may come from a form, questionnaire, interview, etc.]
fields.name: gender

fields.description: Numeric value to represent the year of the death of an individual.
fields.name: year_of_death

fields.description: Numeric value used to describe the number of weeks starting  from the approximate date of the biological mother's last menstrual period and ending with the birth of the patient.
fields.name: weeks_gestation_at_birth

fields.description: The yes/no/unknown indicator used to describe whether the patient was premature (less than 37 weeks gestation) at birth.
fields.name: premature_at_birth

fields.description: An arbitrary classification of a taxonomic group that is a division of a species. It usually arises as a consequence of geographical isolation within a species and is characterized by shared heredity, physical attributes and behavior, and in the case of humans, by common history, nationality, or geographic distribution. The provided values are based on the categories defined by the U.S. Office of Management and Business and used by the U.S. Census Bureau.
fields.name: race

fields.description: A combination of date and time of day in the form [-]CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[Z|(+|-)hh:mm]
fields.name: updated_datetime

fields.description: An individual's self-described social and cultural grouping, specifically whether an individual describes themselves as Hispanic or Latino. The provided values are based on the categories defined by the U.S. Office of Management and Business and used by the U.S. Census Bureau.
fields.name: ethnicity

fields.description: The text term used to describe the patient's country of residence at the time they were enrolled in the study.
fields.name: country_of_residence_at_enrollment

fields.description: Numeric value to represent the calendar year in which an individual was born.
fields.name: year_of_birth

fields.description: The text term used to describe the source used to determine the patient's cause of death.
fields.name: cause_of_death_source

fields.description: A project-specific identifier for a node. This property is the calling card/nickname/alias for a unit of submission. It can be used in place of the UUID for identifying or recalling a node.
fields.name: submitter_id

fields.description: The survival state of the person registered on the protocol.
fields.name: vital_status

fields.description: Text term to identify the cause of death for a patient.
fields.name: cause_of_death

fields.description: The number of years a patient worked in a specific occupation.
fields.name: occupation_duration_years

fields.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date from a person's date of birth represented as a calculated negative number of days.
fields.name: days_to_birth

fields.description: The age or other properties related to the patient's age have been modified for compliance reasons. The actual age may differ from what was reported in order to comply with the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA).
fields.name: age_is_obfuscated

fields.description: The current state of the object.
fields.name: state

fields.description: The patient's age (in years) on the reference or anchor date date used during date obfuscation.
fields.name: age_at_index

fields.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date from a person's date of death represented as a calculated number of days.
fields.name: days_to_death

fields.description: A combination of date and time of day in the form [-]CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[Z|(+|-)hh:mm]
fields.name: created_datetime

fields.description: Numeric value that represents the number of baseline target lesions, as described by the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumours (RECIST) criteria.
fields.name: recist_targeted_regions_number

fields.description: Code assigned to describe the patient's response or outcome to the disease.
fields.name: disease_response

fields.description: The text term used to describe the type of hysterectomy the patient had.
fields.name: hysterectomy_type

fields.description: The current state of the object.
fields.name: state

fields.description: A calculated numerical quantity that represents an individual's weight to height ratio.
fields.name: bmi

fields.description: The percentage comparison to a normal value reference range of the volume of air that a patient can forcibly exhale from the lungs in one second post-bronchodilator.
fields.name: fev1_ref_post_bronch_percent

fields.description: The yes/no/unknown indicator used to describe whether the patient received treatment for a risk factor the patient had at the time of or prior to their diagnosis.
fields.name: hepatitis_sustained_virological_response

fields.description: The text term used to indicate whether the patient received Highly Active Antiretroviral Therapy (HARRT).
fields.name: haart_treatment_indicator

fields.description: The text term used to describe a risk factor the patient had at the time of or prior to their diagnosis.
fields.name: risk_factor

fields.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date of the patient's last follow-up appointment or contact.
fields.name: days_to_follow_up

fields.description: Numeric value to represent the year that the patient was diagnosed with clinical chronic pancreatitis.
fields.name: pancreatitis_onset_year

fields.description: The text term used to describe the type of immunosuppresive treatment the patient received.
fields.name: immunosuppressive_treatment_type

fields.description: Yes/No/Unknown indicator to identify whether a patient has had a new tumor event after initial treatment.
fields.name: progression_or_recurrence

fields.description: Numeric value that represents the concentration of an analyte or aliquot extracted from the sample or sample portion, measured in milligrams per milliliter.
fields.name: hiv_viral_load

fields.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date the patient's disease progressed.
fields.name: days_to_progression

fields.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date of the patient's adverse event.
fields.name: days_to_adverse_event

fields.description: The text term used to describe the anatomic site of the progressive or recurrent disease.
fields.name: progression_or_recurrence_anatomic_site

fields.description: Text term used to describe the types of treatment used to manage diabetes.
fields.name: diabetes_treatment_type

fields.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date the patient's disease recurred.
fields.name: days_to_recurrence

fields.description: The ECOG functional performance status of the patient/participant.
fields.name: ecog_performance_status

fields.description: The text term used to describe the type of evidence used to determine whether the patient's disease recurred.
fields.name: evidence_of_recurrence_type

fields.description: A project-specific identifier for a node. This property is the calling card/nickname/alias for a unit of submission. It can be used in place of the UUID for identifying or recalling a node.
fields.name: submitter_id

fields.description: Text term used to describe the classification used of the functional capabilities of a person.
fields.name: karnofsky_performance_status

fields.description: The text term used to describe the suspected cause or reason for the patient disease response.
fields.name: cause_of_response

fields.description: Text classification to represent the strain or type of human papillomavirus identified in an individual.
fields.name: hpv_positive_type

fields.description: A combination of date and time of day in the form [-]CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[Z|(+|-)hh:mm]
fields.name: created_datetime

fields.description: The text term used to describe a risk factor for human immunodeficiency virus, as described by the Center for Disease Control.
fields.name: cdc_hiv_risk_factors

fields.description: The height of the patient in centimeters.
fields.name: height

fields.description: Numeric value that represents the sum of baseline target lesions, as described by the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumours (RECIST) criteria.
fields.name: recist_targeted_regions_sum

fields.description: Text term used to describe the patient's menopause status.
fields.name: menopause_status

fields.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date the patient's disease was formally confirmed as progression-free.
fields.name: days_to_progression_free

fields.description: The text term used to indicate whether the patient used hormonal contraceptives.
fields.name: hormonal_contraceptive_use

fields.description: The percentage comparison to a normal value reference range of the volume of air that a patient can forcibly exhale from the lungs in one second pre-bronchodilator.
fields.name: fev1_ref_pre_bronch_percent

fields.description: Text term that describes the kind of serological laboratory test used to determine the patient's hepatitus status.
fields.name: viral_hepatitis_serologies

fields.description: The text term used to describe the type of tracer used during the imaging or scan of the patient.
fields.name: scan_tracer_used

fields.description: The yes/no/unknown indicator used to describe whether goblet cells were determined to be present in a patient diagnosed with Barrett's esophagus.
fields.name: barretts_esophagus_goblet_cells_present

fields.description: The text term used to describe the type of imaging or scan performed on the patient.
fields.name: imaging_type

fields.description: The text term used to indicate whether the patient's disease was determined to be involved based on the surgical margins of the hysterectomy.
fields.name: hysterectomy_margins_involved

fields.description: The text term used to describe a specific histone variants, which are proteins that substitute for the core canonical histones.
fields.name: adverse_event_grade

fields.description: The yes/no/unknown indicator used to describe whether the patient received treatment for a risk factor the patient had at the time of or prior to their diagnosis.
fields.name: risk_factor_treatment

fields.description: The text term used to describe the type of pregnancy the patient had.
fields.name: pregnancy_outcome

fields.description: The weight of the patient measured in kilograms.
fields.name: weight

fields.description: Percentage value to represent result of Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 second (FEV1) divided by the Forced Vital Capacity (FVC) post-bronchodilator.
fields.name: fev1_fvc_post_bronch_percent

fields.description: The text term used to describe the outcome of the procedure to determine the amount of the CD4 expressing cells in a sample.
fields.name: cd4_count

fields.description: Numeric value used to represent the 2-dimensional extent of the body surface relating height to weight.
fields.name: body_surface_area

fields.description: A combination of date and time of day in the form [-]CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[Z|(+|-)hh:mm]
fields.name: updated_datetime

fields.description: Percentage value to represent result of Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 second (FEV1) divided by the Forced Vital Capacity (FVC) pre-bronchodilator.
fields.name: fev1_fvc_pre_bronch_percent

fields.description: Numeric value that represents the lowest point to which the CD4 count has dropped (nadir).
fields.name: nadir_cd4_count

fields.description: The text term used to describe a risk factor of  the acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS) that the patient either had at time time of the study or experienced in the past.
fields.name: aids_risk_factors

fields.description: The text term used to describe the method used to diagnose the patient's comorbidity disease.
fields.name: comorbidity_method_of_diagnosis

fields.description: The text term used to describe the result of the imaging or scan performed on the patient.
fields.name: imaging_result

fields.description: Text that represents the Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events low level term name for an adverse event.
fields.name: adverse_event

fields.description: Text term used to describe the types of treatment used to manage gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD).
fields.name: reflux_treatment_type

fields.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date the imaging or scan was performed on the patient.
fields.name: days_to_imaging

fields.description: The text term used to describe a comorbidity disease, which coexists with the patient's malignant disease.
fields.name: comorbidity

fields.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date the patient was diagnosed with a comorbidity.
fields.name: days_to_comorbidity

fields.description: The value, as a percentage of predicted lung volume, measuring the amount of carbon monoxide detected in a patient's lungs.
fields.name: dlco_ref_predictive_percent

fields.description: The text term used to describe the type of progressive or recurrent disease or relapsed disease.
fields.name: progression_or_recurrence_type

fields.description: Numeric value used to describe the upper limit of the normal range used to describe a healthy individual at the institution where the test was completed.
fields.name: blood_test_normal_range_upper

fields.description: The text term used to describe the biological origin of a specific genetic variant.
fields.name: variant_origin

fields.description: Numeric value used to describe the number of loci tested.
fields.name: loci_count

fields.description: The text term used to describe the medical testing used to diagnose, treat or further understand a patient's disease.
fields.name: laboratory_test

fields.description: The text term used to describe a gene targeted or included in molecular analysis. For rearrangements, this is shold be used to represent the reference gene.
fields.name: gene_symbol

fields.description: The yes/no/unknown indicator used to describe whether the mutation included in molecular testing was known to have an affect on the mismatch repair process.
fields.name: mismatch_repair_mutation

fields.description: Numeric value used to describe the lower limit of the normal range used to describe a healthy individual at the institution where the test was completed.
fields.name: blood_test_normal_range_lower

fields.description: A combination of date and time of day in the form [-]CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[Z|(+|-)hh:mm]
fields.name: created_datetime

fields.description: The text term used to describe a specific histone variants, which are proteins that substitute for the core canonical histones.
fields.name: histone_variant

fields.description: The text term used to describe the molecular consequence of genetic variation.
fields.name: molecular_consequence

fields.description: The text term used to describe an antigen included in molecular testing.
fields.name: antigen

fields.description: The text term used to describe the family, or classification of a group of basic proteins found in chromatin, called histones.
fields.name: histone_family

fields.description: Text term used to describe the number of sets of homologous chromosomes.
fields.name: ploidy

fields.description: The second exon number involved in molecular variation. If a specific genetic variant is being reported, this property can be used to capture the second exon where that variant is located. This property is typically used for a translocation where two different locations are involved in the variation.
fields.name: second_exon

fields.description: Intron number targeted or included in molecular analysis. If a specific genetic variant is being reported, this property can be used to capture the intron where that variant is located.
fields.name: intron

fields.description: The text term used to describe the result of the molecular test. If the test result was a numeric value see test_value.
fields.name: test_result

fields.description: Exon number targeted or included in a molecular analysis. If a specific genetic variant is being reported, this property can be used to capture the exon where that variant is located.
fields.name: exon

fields.description: The text term or numeric value used to describe a sepcific result of a molecular test.
fields.name: test_value

fields.description: The current state of the object.
fields.name: state

fields.description: The text term used to describe the type of analyte used for molecular testing.
fields.name: test_analyte_type

fields.description: A project-specific identifier for a node. This property is the calling card/nickname/alias for a unit of submission. It can be used in place of the UUID for identifying or recalling a node.
fields.name: submitter_id

fields.description: The text term used to describe the method used for molecular analysis.
fields.name: molecular_analysis_method

fields.description: Alphanumeric value used to describe the locus of a specific genetic variant. Example: NM_001126114.
fields.name: locus

fields.description: The text used to describe a variant's level of involvement in the cause of the patient's disease according to the standards outlined by the American College of Medical Genetics and Genomics (ACMG).
fields.name: pathogenicity

fields.description: Alphanumeric value used to describe the cytoband or chromosomal location targeted or included in molecular analysis. If a specific genetic variant is being reported, this property can be used to capture the cytoband where the variant is located. Format: [chromosome][chromosome arm].[band+sub-bands]. Example: 17p13.1.
fields.name: cytoband

fields.description: The text term used to describe a chromosome targeted or included in molecular testing. If a specific genetic variant is being reported, this property can be used to capture the chromosome where that variant is located.
fields.name: chromosome

fields.description: Alphanumeric value used to describe the transcript of a specific genetic variant.
fields.name: transcript

fields.description: A combination of date and time of day in the form [-]CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[Z|(+|-)hh:mm]
fields.name: updated_datetime

fields.description: The text term used to describe the biological material used for testing, diagnostic, treatment or research purposes.
fields.name: biospecimen_type

fields.description: Numeric value used to describe the number of times a section of the genome is repeated or copied within an insertion, duplication or deletion variant.
fields.name: copy_number

fields.description: The text term used to describe whether a genomic variant is related by descent from a single progenitor cell.
fields.name: clonality

fields.description: Alphanumeric value used to describe the amino acid change for a specific genetic variant. Example: R116Q.
fields.name: aa_change

fields.description: The text term used to describe the type of genetic variation.
fields.name: variant_type

fields.description: The text term used to describe the zygosity of a specific genetic variant.
fields.name: zygosity

fields.description: The text term used to describe the units of the test value for a molecular test. This property is used in conjunction with test_value.
fields.name: test_units

fields.description: The text term used to describe a secondary gene targeted or included in molecular analysis. For rearrangements, this is should represent the location of the variant.
fields.name: second_gene_symbol

fields.description: Numeric value used to describe the number of loci determined to be abnormal.
fields.name: loci_abnormal_count

fields.description: Numeric value used to describe the number of cells used for molecular testing.
fields.name: cell_count

fields.description: Text term used to describe a specific test that is not covered in the list of molecular analysis methods.
fields.name: specialized_molecular_test

fields.description: The possible states a project can be in.  All but `open` are equivalent to some type of locked state.
fields.name: state

fields.description: Primary site for the project
fields.name: primary_site

fields.description: Display name for the project
fields.name: name

fields.description: A project can only be released by the user when `releasable` is true.
fields.name: releasable

fields.description: The dbgap accession number for the project.
fields.name: dbgap_accession_number

fields.description: To release a project is to tell the GDC to include all submitted entities in the next GDC index.
fields.name: released

fields.description: Full name for the project
fields.name: disease_type

fields.description: The subgroup that describes the state of connectedness between members of the unit of society organized around kinship ties.
fields.name: relationship_type

fields.description: A combination of date and time of day in the form [-]CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[Z|(+|-)hh:mm]
fields.name: created_datetime

fields.description: A combination of date and time of day in the form [-]CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[Z|(+|-)hh:mm]
fields.name: updated_datetime

fields.description: The age (in years) when the patient's relative was first diagnosed.
fields.name: relationship_age_at_diagnosis

fields.description: The text term used to describe the malignant diagnosis of the patient's relative with a history of cancer.
fields.name: relationship_primary_diagnosis

fields.description: The yes/no/unknown indicator used to describe whether any of the patient's relatives have a history of cancer.
fields.name: relative_with_cancer_history

fields.description: The text term used to describe the gender of the patient's relative with a history of cancer.
fields.name: relationship_gender

fields.description: The current state of the object.
fields.name: state

fields.description: The number of relatives the patient has with a known history of cancer.
fields.name: relatives_with_cancer_history_count

fields.description: A project-specific identifier for a node. This property is the calling card/nickname/alias for a unit of submission. It can be used in place of the UUID for identifying or recalling a node.
fields.name: submitter_id
